Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.gods

Class MultipleBuildDelegate

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.gods.MultipleBuildDelegate
class MultipleBuildDelegate
extends java.lang.Object
This class represent the delegate that Gods can use if their power provides the possibility to build more than one time each turn.

The use of this kind of delegates allows the application of the Composition over Inheritance principle, making it easy to have Gods that are not strictly categorized and that can instead share and use features which are in common with other Gods, in order to also reduce redundancy and code duplication. Moreover, using Delegates instead of Interfaces allows not only to implement non-static shared methods and centralized state management, but also to avoid the exposure of some methods which should only be used by Gods, and not visible from outside. For this purpose, Delegates class and methods are package-level visibility, while attributes are private to the Delegate.

  • Method Details

    • getBuildCount

      int getBuildCount()
      buildCount getter
      Returns:
      the number of times the god has built in this turn

    • increaseBuildCount

      void increaseBuildCount()
      This method increases the God's build count in order to keep track of the numbers of levels built in a turn.

    • reinitializeBuildCount

      void reinitializeBuildCount()
      This method is resets the buildCount to zero.

    • canBuildAgain

      boolean canBuildAgain()
      This method is used to check if a God can build again in its turn.
      Returns:
      true if and only if the God can build at least another time

    • checkBuild

      boolean checkBuild​(Worker worker, Cell buildCell, BlockType buildCellBlockType, Worker selectedWorker)
      This method is used to check if the build action that Player attempted can be performed. It is necessary because the Gods which have multiple builds power cannot use GodStrategy checkBuild, because it always return false if the Worker already built a block (following the standard game rules).
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker who want to build a new level.
      buildCell - the cell in which the Player want to build a new level.
      buildCellBlockType - [optional] the level that the Worker wants to build.
      selectedWorker - to check if the worker that is trying to build is the same worker that performed movement.
      Returns:
      true if the buildCount is less than the max number of times that the God can build each turn and other standard check are satisfied, false otherwise.
